Text: None
Context: O God, whom I praise, do not remain silent,
column7: David appeals to God for justice—implying trouble and a sense of urgency.

Text: For wicked and deceitful mouths open against me; they speak against me with lying tongues.
Context: David describes the false accusations and deceitful speech of his enemies.

Text: None
Context: They surround me with hateful words and attack me without cause.
column7: David emphasizes the baseless and unprovoked nature of the attacks.

Text: In return for my love, they accuse me, but I am a man of prayer.
Context: Contrasting his love with their false accusations, David identifies himself as committed to prayer regardless of their hostility.

Text: They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
Context: He laments the injustice of receiving evil in return for good and highlights the malice of his adversaries.

Text: None
Context: Appoint a wicked man over him; let an accuser stand at his right hand.
column7: David begins the imprecatory part of the Psalm, calling for judgment upon his accuser.

Text: None
Context: When he is tried, let him be found guilty, and let his prayers be counted as sin.
column7: David's prayer intensifies as he seeks vindication by asking for his enemy's condemnation.

Text: None
Context: May his days be few; may another take his place of leadership.
column7: An appeal for the curtailment of the enemy's influence and leadership role.

Text: May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
Context: David invokes a curse, reflecting common ancient Near Eastern curses, suggesting the depth of the enemy's treachery.

Text: May his children wander as beggars and be driven from their ruined homes.
Context: A continuation of the previous verse's curses, highlighting the social consequences of the adversary's actions.

Text: May a creditor seize all he has; may strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
Context: David calls for financial ruin upon his enemy as a form of divine retribution.

Text: None
Context: May no one extend kindness to him or take pity on his fatherless children.
column7: The imprecation extends to the lack of social support or mercy for the enemy's offspring.

Text: May his descendants be cut off; their names blotted out from the next generation.
Context: The intensity of the curse grows with a call for the obliteration of the adversary's legacy.

Text: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, and the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
Context: Request for perpetual divine remembrance of the sins of his enemy's ancestors.

Text: May their sins always remain before the LORD, that He may cut off their memory from the earth.
Context: David's plea for an end to the remembrance of his enemies, effectively a total eradication of their lineage.

Text: None
Context: Because he did not remember to show kindness, but pursued the poor and needy and brokenhearted to their death.
column7: The reasoning for the severity of the curses; the enemy's persistent cruelty and lack of mercy.

Text: He loved to pronounce a curse—may it come back on him. He found no pleasure in blessing—may it be far from him.
Context: A principle of retribution; the enemy's preference for cursing others will rebound onto himself.

Text: He wore cursing as his garment, it entered into his body like water, like oil into his bones.
Context: Metaphor describing how deeply the enemy's penchant for cursing has affected him; now it will consume him.

Text: May it be like a cloak wrapped about him, like a belt tied forever around him.
Context: Imagery of the enemy's malicious nature being as ever-present and close as the clothes he wears.

Text: None
Context: May this be the LORD's payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil against me.
column7: David seeks justice, asking for such curses to be the reward for his accusers in the hands of God.

Text: But You, O Sovereign LORD, deal well with me for Your Name's sake; deliver me because of Your mercy.
Context: Despite the imprecations, David expresses trust in God's mercy and asks for deliverance.

Text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
Context: He portrays himself as vulnerable and deeply affected by the situation, appealing to God's compassion.

Text: None
Context: I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.
column7: David describes his frailty and the ephemeral nature of his existence as he faces adversity.

Text: None
Context: My knees are weak from fasting; my body is thin and gaunt.
column7: He depicts the physical toll his plight and devotion to God have taken on him.

Text: None
Context: I have become an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.
column7: David describes the contempt he faces from his enemies, who see his weakened state as an opportunity to ridicule him.

Text: Help me, O LORD my God; save me according to Your unfailing love.
Context: An earnest plea for divine intervention and salvation based on God's love.

Text: Let them know that it is Your hand, that You, O LORD, have done it.
Context: David wishes for his enemies to recognize that any deliverance or condemnation is the work of God.

Text: Let them curse, but may You bless; when they arise, let them be put to shame, but let Your servant rejoice.
Context: Even as his enemies continue their malice, David prays for God's favor and their ultimate disgrace.

Text: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace; may they wear their shame like a robe.
Context: Invoking a poetic reversal, he asks that his enemies experience shame as acutely as one feels clothing.

Text: With my mouth I will greatly extol the LORD; in the great throng I will praise Him.
Context: The psalmist vows to publicly praise God, showing his commitment to honor God regardless of circumstances.

Text: For He stands at the right hand of the needy, to save them from those who would condemn them.
Context: Final affirmation of trust that God is a defender of the oppressed and will act on their behalf against the unjust.
